title: 2018 Aston Martin Vanquish Zagato Coupe
description: This 2018 Aston Martin Vanquish Zagato Coupe is the 85th of 99 cars produced and was acquired new by the seller in December 2017 from Luxury Cars Los Gatos in California. Specified from the factory in match-to-sample Hyperion Grey over Pure Black and Spicy Red leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 5.9-liter AM29 V12 linked to an eight-speed automatic gearbox and a limited-slip differential. It has carbon-fiber bodywork with a Zagato double-bubble roof as well as a Z-patterned front grille, carbon-fiber side strakes, and 20" 15-spoke alloy wheels. Inside, 2+2 seating is accompanied by carbon-fiber trim, a Bang & Olufsen audio system, and a One-77-style steering wheel. Further equipment includes an active damping system, launch control, and carbon-ceramic brakes. This Vanquish Zagato Coupe has 2,600 miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a window sticker, manufacturer's literature, service records, accessories, and a clean California title in the name of the owner's trust.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2018 Aston Martin Vanquish Zagato Coupe at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #185,399.
text: This 2018 Aston Martin Vanquish Zagato Coupe is the 85th of 99 cars produced and was acquired new by the seller in December 2017 from Luxury Cars Los Gatos in California. Specified from the factory in match-to-sample Hyperion Grey over Pure Black and Spicy Red leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 5.9-liter AM29 V12 linked to an eight-speed automatic gearbox and a limited-slip differential. It has carbon-fiber bodywork with a Zagato double-bubble roof as well as a Z-patterned front grille, carbon-fiber side strakes, and 20″ 15-spoke alloy wheels. Inside, 2+2 seating is accompanied by carbon-fiber trim, a Bang & Olufsen audio system, and a One-77-style steering wheel. Further equipment includes an active damping system, launch control, and carbon-ceramic brakes. This Vanquish Zagato Coupe has 2,600 miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, accessories, and a clean California title in the name of the owner’s trust. Aston Martin revealed a concept version of the Vanquish Zagato at the May 2016 Concorso d’Eleganza Villa d’Este in Italy and went on to produce four variants of the car including a coupe, convertible, shooting brake, and “speedster.” The Zagato models were distinguished from the contemporary Vanquish by a reworked front grille with round fog lamps as well as Vulcan-inspired “Blade” taillights. The carbon-fiber bodywork of this example is finished in match-to-sample Hyperion Grey and features a double-bubble roof, swan doors, and a retractable rear spoiler. Carbon-fiber side strakes and black tailpipe finishers were optioned from the factory, and additional exterior details include a Z-patterned front grille, Zagato fender badging, and xenon headlights. The seller notes a scrape on the underside of the carbon-fiber front splitter. The 20″ 15-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 305/30 rear Pirelli P-Zero tires. The car is equipped with an adaptive damping system and launch control, while braking is handled by black Aston Martin–branded calipers over ventilated Carbon Ceramic Matrix (CCM) rotors at all four corners. The 2+2 cabin houses seats trimmed in Pure Black and Spicy Red leather from Bridge of Weir with “Z” pattern stitching that extends to the door and side panels. The front seats wear black “Z” embroidery in the headrests and feature heating, power adjustment, and memory settings. Carbon-fiber trim adorns the center stack, and a spring-loaded holder for a branded Lamy pen is located to the right of the hazard-light button. Further appointments include a Bang & Olufsen BeoSound sound system, navigation, front and rear cameras, automatic climate control, cruise control, and parking sensors. Brushed metal plaques on the door sills denote this car as the 85th of 99 Vanquish Zagato Coupes produced. The One-77-style steering wheel sits ahead of column-mounted shift paddles and frames a 240-mph speedometer, a reverse-sweep 8k-rpm tachometer, twin digital readouts, and auxiliary gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. A pop-up screen is located in the center of the dashboard, and the steering wheel and center console wear Shadow Bronze metal accents. The digital odometer indicates 2,600 miles, all of which have been added under current ownership. The 5.9-liter AM29 V12 was factory rated at 580 horsepower and 465 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a carbon-fiber propshaft, a rear-mounted Touchtronic 3 eight-speed automatic gearbox, and a limited-slip differential. An engine oil change and coolant flush were performed in February 2024. The engine plaque is signed by Dr. Andy Palmer, the CEO of Aston Martin when the car was produced. The car is accompanied by a three-piece Aston Martin luggage set specified in Pure Black and Spicy Red leather to match the interior. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. html:
This 2018 Aston Martin Vanquish Zagato Coupe is the 85th of 99 cars produced and was acquired new by the seller in December 2017 from Luxury Cars Los Gatos in California. Specified from the factory in match-to-sample Hyperion Grey over Pure Black and Spicy Red leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 5.9-liter AM29 V12 linked to an eight-speed automatic gearbox and a limited-slip differential. It has carbon-fiber bodywork with a Zagato double-bubble roof as well as a Z-patterned front grille, carbon-fiber side strakes, and 20″ 15-spoke alloy wheels. Inside, 2+2 seating is accompanied by carbon-fiber trim, a Bang & Olufsen audio system, and a One-77-style steering wheel. Further equipment includes an active damping system, launch control, and carbon-ceramic brakes. This Vanquish Zagato Coupe has 2,600 miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, accessories, and a clean California title in the name of the owner’s trust.

Aston Martin revealed a concept version of the Vanquish Zagato at the May 2016 Concorso d’Eleganza Villa d’Este in Italy and went on to produce four variants of the car including a coupe, convertible, shooting brake, and “speedster.” The Zagato models were distinguished from the contemporary Vanquish by a reworked front grille with round fog lamps as well as Vulcan-inspired “Blade” taillights.

The carbon-fiber bodywork of this example is finished in match-to-sample Hyperion Grey and features a double-bubble roof, swan doors, and a retractable rear spoiler. Carbon-fiber side strakes and black tailpipe finishers were optioned from the factory, and additional exterior details include a Z-patterned front grille, Zagato fender badging, and xenon headlights. The seller notes a scrape on the underside of the carbon-fiber front splitter.

The 20″ 15-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 305/30 rear Pirelli P-Zero tires. The car is equipped with an adaptive damping system and launch control, while braking is handled by black Aston Martin–branded calipers over ventilated Carbon Ceramic Matrix (CCM) rotors at all four corners.

The 2+2 cabin houses seats trimmed in Pure Black and Spicy Red leather from Bridge of Weir with “Z” pattern stitching that extends to the door and side panels. The front seats wear black “Z” embroidery in the headrests and feature heating, power adjustment, and memory settings. Carbon-fiber trim adorns the center stack, and a spring-loaded holder for a branded Lamy pen is located to the right of the hazard-light button. Further appointments include a Bang & Olufsen BeoSound sound system, navigation, front and rear cameras, automatic climate control, cruise control, and parking sensors.

Brushed metal plaques on the door sills denote this car as the 85th of 99 Vanquish Zagato Coupes produced.

The One-77-style steering wheel sits ahead of column-mounted shift paddles and frames a 240-mph speedometer, a reverse-sweep 8k-rpm tachometer, twin digital readouts, and auxiliary gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. A pop-up screen is located in the center of the dashboard, and the steering wheel and center console wear Shadow Bronze metal accents. The digital odometer indicates 2,600 miles, all of which have been added under current ownership.

The 5.9-liter AM29 V12 was factory rated at 580 horsepower and 465 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a carbon-fiber propshaft, a rear-mounted Touchtronic 3 eight-speed automatic gearbox, and a limited-slip differential. An engine oil change and coolant flush were performed in February 2024.

The engine plaque is signed by Dr. Andy Palmer, the CEO of Aston Martin when the car was produced.

The car is accompanied by a three-piece Aston Martin luggage set specified in Pure Black and Spicy Red leather to match the interior.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
